intro: Leuconoe crenatus, commonly known as the crested leuconoe, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant is native to parts of Europe and Asia, often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its distinctive appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in botanical studies. Leuconoe crenatus is also valued for its historical use in traditional medicine.
